newsitem.title: USA: Texas power prices hold steady at strong levels.
newsitem.headline: Texas power prices hold steady at strong levels.

text.p: Bulk wholesale power prices in the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) held steady Thursday at strong levels supported by robust natural gas prices, industry sources said.
Peak, firm electricity in ERCOT for Friday delivery was talked steady at $27.00-30.00 per megawatt hour (MWh), the brokers and marketers said.
Off-peak ERCOT power for Friday delivery was talked steady at $20.00-22.00 per MWh, the sources said.

November peak ERCOT power was discussed steady to higher at $25.00-26.00 from a Wednesday range of $24.00-26.00, while December peak power was said to be offered at $24.50 with little business reported done.
January/February ERCOT power was talked at $25.25-25.50, the sources said.
-- Chris Reese, New York Power Desk 212-859-1627
